## Understanding the BAMLSS model frame

Similar to the well-known `model.frame()` function that is used, e.g., by the linear model 
fitting function `lm()` or for generalized linear models `glm()`, the `bamlss.frame()`
function extracts a model frame for fitting distributional regression models. Internally,
the function parsers model formulae, one for each parameter of the distribution,
using the _Formula_ package infrastructures [@bamlss:Zeileis+Croissant:2010] in combination
with `smooth.construct()` processing of the _mgcv_ package to setup design and penalty
matrices with prior functions and respective derivatives for unspecified smooth function
estimation [@bamlss:Wood:2018] (see also the documentation of function `s()`).
